intro: Brachyscome perpusilla, commonly known as the fairy duster, is a small flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelion blooms. The plant produces small, fluffy white or pink flower heads that are often mistaken for dandelion seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions and sandy soils. Brachyscome perpusilla is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ease of care.
